data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 10 steps forward, and you have 9 steps left to go left again.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around you turn right. The opposite directions in turn around is the same as take 4 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

To return to the starting point, you must take all the steps in both sets of instructions. So, the answer is Yes.

If you start with 7 steps, take one step. If you continue with 7 steps, take 7 steps. If you turn left, take 5 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The instructions are for 1 person. If you follow the directions, you take 3 steps forward, 3 steps backward then 3 steps backwards. When you take 3 steps forward, you take 3 steps in one direction and 3 steps in one direction. Taking 3 steps forward and take 3 steps in one direction is a rotation of your body. Take 3 steps backward and take 3 steps in one direction is a rotation of your body. Taking 3 steps back backward can be one rotation of your body. When you take 3 steps backward, you take 3 steps in one direction as well as 3 steps in one direction. When you take 3 steps backward, you take 3 steps backward taking 3 steps backward. So, the answer is yes.
